member.name: T:OpenJijDotNet.OpenJijObject

member.name: M:OpenJijDotNet.OpenJijObject.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified value indicating whether this instance is disposable.
member.param: true if this instance is disposable; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:OpenJijDotNet.OpenJijObject.IsDisposed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance has been disposed.
member.returns: true if this instance has been disposed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:OpenJijDotNet.OpenJijObject.IsEnableDispose
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is disposable.
member.returns: true if this instance is disposable; otherwise, false.

members.member: Gets a pointer of native structure. >

member.name: M:OpenJijDotNet.OpenJijObject.ThrowIfDisposed
member.summary: If this object is disposed, then is thrown.

member.name: M:OpenJijDotNet.OpenJijObject.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by this .

member.name: M:OpenJijDotNet.OpenJijObject.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases all resources used by this .

member.name: F:OpenJijDotNet.NativeMethods.NativeLibrary
member.summary: Native library file name. If Linux, it will be converted to libOpenJijDotNetNative.so If MacOSX, it will be converted to libOpenJijDotNetNative.dylib If Windows, it will be available after call LoadLibrary. And this file name must not contain period. If it does, CLR does not add extension (.dll) and CLR fails to load library
